content:
A Pareto distribution is a right-skewed distribution that can be used to model income or wealth distributions. It is characterized by a shape parameter (α) and a scale parameter (k).

To model y with a Pareto distribution, you can generate a random sample of values from the Pareto distribution and use these values as inputs to the existing functions you have defined. Here's how you can generate the sample in MATLAB:
```makefile
% Define the parameters of the Pareto distribution
alpha = 2;
k = 1;

% Generate a random sample of values from the Pareto distribution
n = 1000; % number of samples
y = k * (1-rand(1,n)).^(-1/alpha);
```
You can then use the `y` values as inputs to your existing `eval_lambdas` and `eval_lambdat` functions to get the corresponding values of the cut-off values `lambda`.
